search_results.snippet:
A helen is a humorous unit of measurement based on the concept that Helen of 
Troy, from the Iliad, had a "face that launched a thousand ships". The helen is 
thus used to measure quantities of beauty in terms of the ... mathematician W.A.H. 
Rushton. However, the term was possibly first suggested by Isaac Asimov.
